Job Title: IMI CIB - Business Analyst Financial Sponsors Group - New York Branch
Job Description:
Intesa Sanpaolo is the banking group leader in Italy. Assisting more than 14,6 milion of retail customers through a network of 5360 branches, it significantly supports the development of Companies and gives an important sustain to the country's growth. The Group has a selected retail banking presence in Central and Eastern Europe, the Middle East and North Africa, with approximately 1,000 branches and 7.2 million customers in 12 countries. Intesa Sanpaolo is also present in 25 countries in support of its corporate customers’ cross-border business. It is looking for new qualified profiles who want to face demanding and challenging career path with the following requirements:

Scope and Purpose

In support of the Global Relationship Manager (GRM) Financial Sponsors International, the Business Analyst will:

Support the GRM in all tasks related to developing new and expanding existing relationships with Private Equity clients
Perform due diligence on PE clients, fund structures, acquisition targets, industries, and other relevant information as required
Prepare PE and company profiles and pitches
Support in the identification of business opportunities and cross-selling of Intesa Sanpaolo’s financial products and services
Accompany and support the GRM in meeting with clients, in negotiating and structuring transactions
Manage multiple transactions/projects and communicate effectively with deal team members on status and prioritization
Coordinate between and establish strong working partnerships and routines with key internal partners including Leveraged Finance, Fund Finance, Syndication, Debt Capital Markets, Credit, Risk, Industry Verticals, KYC and Legal
Support the preparation of credit applications for LBO and fund finance deals, portfolio summaries and reviews
Perform specific administrative and operative activities related to customer onboarding and management
Demonstrate knowledge of relevant credit policies and procedures and accurately identify policy exceptions
Ensure the Branch’s KYC (Know Your Customers) and CDD (Customers Due Diligence) procedures and directives are adhered to.

The salary range for this job offer would be $ 85,000 - $ 110,000

Required Experience

Ideally 2- 3 years of work experience in a Leveraged Finance, Sponsor Coverage or Capital Markets role
Proficiency in MS Office (Excel, Word and PowerPoint)
Experience with Bloomberg, SEC filings, rating agency reports, and equity research reports is a plus.

Competencies Required

Good understanding of Leveraged Buyout (“LBO”) transactions and Private Equity (“PE”) fund structures
Knowledge of the Syndicated Loan Market
Strong quantitative and analytical skills, with the ability to understand and analyze syndicated deal structures and loan documentation
Familiarity with commercial, corporate and investment banking products
Resourceful self-starter, with willingness to learn, superior attention to detail, professional demeanour, and ability to work effectively on multiple projects
Teamwork attitude, with ability to interact and build healthy working relations in a culturally diverse environment
Excellent communication skills
Fluency in English

Required Qualifications, Skills and Knowledge

Bachelor’s degree in Finance, Accounting or Business Administration, with an emphasis on Corporate Finance, Financial Accounting or Economics

Everyone is an asset for our Group and that person could be you! Check out our job opportunities, apply and join our team!

Location: New York, US

Job Type: Full-time

Work Location: On the road

Job Responsibilities:

Gathers, organizes, and evaluates relevant information, such as financial statements, vendor contracts, and EHR system specifications.
Communicates with internal and external stakeholders and conducts interviews as necessary to understand current practices and determine possible areas for improvement.
Analyzes department revenue, profits and losses.
Designs alternative plans and solutions for possible implementation to improve aspect of the departments.
Assists with project management at multiple stages, including the research, business plan preparation and presentation.
Performs administrative tasks such as creating or updating manuals for departmental policies and procedures as they relate to revenue cycle, operations and human resources (non-clinical).
Conducts in-depth data analysis, using spreadsheets or more specialized tools such as project management software and traceability solutions.
Utilizes departmental score cards to track and assess needs based on statistical information.
Performs quarterly reviews of departmental performance based on score cards to implement needed changes or adjustments in coordination with Department Administrator.
Assists, as needed, with physician enrollment during onboarding process to ensure accuracy and timely payer enrollment.
Assists Department Administrator with regular faculty interaction at all locations to ensure communication is consistent and beneficial.
Demonstrates willingness to seek and complete needed training for EHR systems, data analytics and data collection/organization.
Assists Department Administrator and appropriate staff with recruitment efforts to include scheduling, provider needs assessment and related business plans.
Performs other duties as assigned or requested.
Education: Bachelor’s degree in business, healthcare administration or related field. Master’s degree in healthcare administration preferred.
Experience: Prefer 1 year work experience, preferably in an academic ambulatory practice setting.

Internal applicants must call HR at ext. 11653 to determine eligibility before applying.

Job Title: Business Applications Specialist -- Business Intelligence & Data Analytics -- Northgate-400 Associat
Job Description:
The Business Applications Specialist is responsible for combining business knowledge, clinical workflow, and data analysis within a continuous financial and process improvement framework. The Business Applications Specialist performs a variety of simple and complex activities to provide CAMC business entities with insights to maintain, improve or transform the business and technology framework. Responsible for application support and implementation within the Information Services Department. Demonstrates elevated computer operational skills. Should be able to perform difficult application diagnostics and troubleshooting. Must be able to mentor more junior level staff on departmental procedure and application support and/or implementation procedures. Understand and promote all IT services available to the organization. Demonstrates and the ability to follow I/S Departmental and CAMC Organizational governance commitments including (but not limited to) ticket management, training, testing, implementing, and validating service requests and/or requested modifications through the departments change control process. Promote the departments’ services within the organization as well as develop Informatics practices to ensure departmental quality and process measurements are included. Demonstrates a basic understanding and adheres to departmental processes for change control. Maintains a level of cybersecurity knowledge sufficient to securely accomplish their job duties.


Responsibilities

1. Coordinates and Assists users and IT personnel with training and development of user documentation. 2. Develops system design, including functional specifications, and implements strategies based upon the analysis of specific operational needs. 3. Evaluates, designs, builds, tests, and implements custom or vendor supplied software and develops system-wide reports to support information management needs. 4. Maintains production systems to ensure reliable performance. 5. Prepares complete unit, system, and integrated test plans and test methodologies. 6. Provides day-to-day operations support to customers as required. 7. Coordinates efforts between stakeholders from multiple areas in order to gather requirements, develop technical specifications, and test enhancements and other changes to these systems. 8. Identifies data integrity issues and analyzes data and process flows for process improvement opportunities. 9. Develops & Performs data analysis in order to extract requirements, identify data inaccuracies, and ensure accurate processing and reporting. 10. Identifies policies and requirements that drive a specific solution. 11. Works effectively on project teams and meets deadlines in accordance to project manager's expectations. 12. Works with stakeholders to build, test and maintain integration points with multiple vendor solutions 13. Utilizes detailed instructions to perform routine support and implementation work. 14. Utilizes appropriate and timely communication skills within assigned team. 15. Must have appropriate and timely communications skills to communicate with senior level management. 16. Completed certification/accreditation for specific vendor and/or governing body related to specific applications/tools for which responsibility is held for support. 17. Participates in contract review process, which will include initial vendor contact and contract review prior to delivering to management for further review, negotiation, and execution. 18. On call as required. 19. Flexible hours when needed. 20. All other duties as assigned.


Knowledge, Skills & Abilities

Patient Group Knowledge (Only applies to positions with direct patient contact) The employee must possess/obtain (by the end of the orientation period) and demonstrate the knowledge and skills necessary to provide developmentally appropriate assessment, treatment or care as defined by the department’s identified patient ages. Specifically the employee must be able to demonstrate competency in: 1) ability to obtain and interpret information in terms of patient needs; 2) knowledge of growth and development; and 3) understanding of the range of treatment needed by the patients. Competency Statement Must demonstrate competency through an initial orientation and ongoing competency validation to independently perform tasks and additional duties as specified in the job description and the unit/department specific competency checklist. Common Duties and Responsibilities (Essential duties common to all positions) 1. Maintain and document all applicable required education. 2. Demonstrate positive customer service and co-worker relations. 3. Comply with the company's attendance policy. 4. Participate in the continuous, quality improvement activities of the department and institution. 5. Perform work in a cost effective manner. 6. Perform work in accordance with all departmental pay practices and scheduling policies, including but not limited to, overtime, various shift work, and on-call situations. 7. Perform work in alignment with the overall mission and strategic plan of the organization. 8. Follow organizational and departmental policies and procedures, as applicable. 9. Perform related duties as assigned.


Education

• Bachelor's Degree (Required) Education: Bachelor’s Degree and Advanced Certifications or equivalent experience in Business Administration, Health Administration, Information Systems, Information Technology or related field Master’s Degree and Advanced Certifications preferred Experience: 10 years of related information technology, financial systems support, and/or related business/healthcare experience


Credentials

• No Certification, Competency or License Required

Welcome! We’re excited you’re considering an opportunity with us! To apply to this position and be considered, click the Apply button located above this message and complete the application in full. Below, you’ll find other important information about this position.

This positon will focus on the day-to-day business operations of a signature service line within WVU Medicine. This position contributes to meeting departmental goals through identifying revenue enhancement, expense management, and project development opportunities. This position will take a lead in several business functions which include, but aren’t limited to; oversight and coordination of service contracts with non-WVU Medicine entities, project management and deployment of new tools and software systems, and monitoring, analysis, and report coordination of operational metrics key to the success of the department.

Position will provide administrative oversight of the P&T process for WVU School of Medicine faculty.

Position will work collaboratively with leadership at all levels to ensure that the process is handled in a timely and efficient manner from start to finish. This includes oversight of communications among all parties involved, dissemination of information, scheduling meetings and ensuring that all WVU Provost’s Office deadlines are met.

Serves as a resource and contact for SOM faculty leaders and departmental administrators relative to the WVU SOM P&T function.

Position will act as the SOM Dean’s Office web developer and will be the unit’s authority on established WVU website protocols and guidelines. In collaboration with the HSC/SOM office of communications, the position is responsible for all website material to be current and within established WVU guidelines.

Position will assist the WVU SOM Associate Dean – Faculty and Practice Plan Affairs with the timely preparation, review and dissemination of SOM faculty offer letters, inclusive the processing advance rank/tenure requests.

This positon will focus on the day-to-day business operations of a signature service line within WVU Medicine. This position contributes to meeting departmental goals through identifying revenue enhancement, expense management, and project development opportunities. This position will take a lead in several business functions which include, but aren’t limited to; oversight and coordination of service contracts with non-WVU Medicine entities, project management and deployment of new tools and software systems, and monitoring, analysis, and report coordination of operational metrics key to the success of the department.

MINIMUM QUALIFICATIONS :

EDUCATION, CERTIFICATION, AND/OR LICENSURE:

1. Bachelor’s Degree in Business Administration, Finance, Accounting, Economics, or related field.

PREFERRED QUALIFICATIONS :

EDUCATION, CERTIFICATION, AND/OR LICENSURE:

1. Two (2) years of related work experience preferred.

CORE DUTIES AND RESPONSIBILITIES: The statements described here are intended to describe the general nature of work being performed by people assigned to this position. They are not intended to be constructed as an all-inclusive list of all responsibilities and duties. Other duties may be assigned.

1. Conducts analysis in order to support leadership in investigating and improving budget. Reports conclusions and recommends strategies to resolve any variances.

2. Manages and coordinates projects with external vendors to bring on new services and software in facilitating departmental goals. Ensures Projects are meeting established timelines, performing within projected pro-forma’s and budgets, and remaining within scope.

3. Conducts and participates in business meetings with Divisional and Regional leadership. Includes creating and improving reporting packages with operational, qualitative, and fiscal performance.

4. Manages expectations and engages management to review/resolve any potential changes to project scope, expected deliverables, etc.

5. Performs analysis of reporting revenue and investigates areas for improvement. Develops reporting to track, trend, and monitor success of revenue initiatives.

6. Reviews and summarizes large amounts of expense data with an ability to highlight areas for expense reduction to improve bottom line.

7. Uses analytical methods to ensure reported data is meaningful and accurate.

8. Develops technical ability in data analytics using various systems and tools.

9. Provides support in problem identification, resolution, and solution design for a variety of business needs.

10. Serves as first point of contact for department. Interfaces with hospital leadership and staff of various levels, with an ability to translate and communicate business concepts into actionable and meaningful terms.

11. Reviews, identifies and documents any issues, barriers, or risks and brings them to management’s attention.

12. Participates in post implementation review of projects.

Job Title: HHR Specialist, Sr. - PATH Child Welfare Business Systems Analyst
Company Name: West Virginia Department of Health and Human Resources
Job Description:
Please note, by clicking Apply, you are requesting that a DHHR Recruitment Team Member reach out to you regarding further application steps.

Nature of Work

As a PATH Child Welfare Business Systems Analyst, this position serves as a statewide expert of defined focus areas within the CW application and requires expertise in both the program content and the technical skills needed to support the software serving the program. This position collaborates with stakeholders to promote, protect, manage, and provide appropriate health and human services for our residents to improve their health, well-being, and quality of life. This position provides expert business analysis in the development, enhancement, and maintenance of all DHHR computer systems to provide customers and staff systems that is efficient, well maintained, and compliant with Federal and State Requirements. The position fills the gap between state technical staff, IT contractors (mainly OPTUM) and state policy staff to assure that what is programmed in the application (FACTS, OSCAR, RAPIDS, or PATH) is implemented appropriately and correctly to follow the system rules while also following the policies/administrative rules that govern the programs.

Minimum Qualifications

Training: Bachelor's Degree from a regionally accredited four-year college or university.

Substitution: Additional experience as described below may be substituted for the required training on a year-for-year basis.

Experience: Four years full-time, equivalent part-time paid or volunteer experience in a technical or program area that is related to the area of employment.

Substitution: Post-graduate education in a field related to the technical or program area may be substituted for the required experience on the basis of fifteen semester hours for one year of experience.

Job Type: Full-time

Pay: $35,994.00 - $66,589.00 per year

Benefits:

401(k)
401(k) matching
Dental insurance
Employee assistance program
Health insurance
Life insurance
Paid time off
Retirement plan
Tuition reimbursement
Vision insurance

8 hour shift

Responsibilities:
Essential Duties:
This is an on-site role, located in Charleston, WV.
Under general supervision, responsible for directly supporting various business units in their utilization of SAP module.
Leads sub-projects of the SAP applications, and operates as an internal consultant and thought leader with the business users.
Works with business units to ensure project objectives are well defined, tracked and completed on schedule.
Has a role in ensuring the smooth integration and rollout of systems by coordinating closely with the affected functional area.
Responsible for quickly resolving and documenting day to day issues as they arise.
Provide and transfer functional and process knowledge of the latest SAP releases and practices by keeping current on various published materials and training outlets.
Assist key business users in creating the functional requirements needed to alter SAP in line with changes in business practices.
Responsible for translating the user’s functional specifications into a technical specification on which the new SAP configuration will be based.
Provide ongoing training and knowledge transfer to users to enable them to become self-sufficient in the operation and training of the system.
Provide support to key users in end user training and “go-live” support.
Adhere to all company policies and procedures and, if applicable, all company policies relating to IATF16949 and ISO14000.
Knowledge of SAP modules: PP/QM as well as WM & MM.
Qualifications:
Academic Skills/Knowledge/Experience:
Bachelor’s degree preferred.
Minimum of 5 years of industry experience and/or SAP process knowledge required.
Minimum of 3 years hands on experience as subject matter expert or user with proven capabilities in systems analysis, application design and configuration.
Experience in unit testing, developing/testing application interfaces and integration testing
Experience in a multicultural environment preferred
Strong written and oral communication skills
Excellent organization, planning and administration
Experience in SAP SD required
Candidate must be located or willing to relocate a resonable distance from Charleston, WV after a hiring offer is made.

Senior Business Intelligence Analyst

Context

The shift within Higher Education more from one-time purchases of print textbooks to recurring subscriptions of digital products has generated a wealth of data about our products, customers, opportunities, and sales.

We’re looking for a leader who can take this information and leverage the latest data analytics tools, especially Tableau, to provide insight into the performance of business.

Reporting to the Director of Business Intelligence and sitting within the Strategic Sales Operations wing of US Higher Ed Sales Operations, the Sr Business Intelligence Analyst leads the analyses of the sales pipeline, net sales, subscriptions, and market data across multiple formats, models, and channels.

Responsibilities

Forecasting Mastery: Take the helm in owning all aspects of forecasting seasonal revenue, turning data into a strategic asset for our team.
Collaborative Insight: Work closely with cross-functional teams, including sales, marketing, finance, and product, to deliver accessible and consumable insights into the success of our higher education products.
Dashboard Stewardship: Support the lifecycle of our Tableau dashboards, ensuring they remain up to date with the latest features and capabilities while streamlining and retiring those that are no longer necessary.
Analytical Evolution : Drive the evolution of our analytics capabilities from self-service to predictive and early alert insights into product, sales, and market trends.
Data Integrity Guardian : Manage functional areas of data management, forecasting, contacts, leads, opportunities, dashboards, and reports, ensuring data integrity across our systems.
Strategic Partner: Assist in turning sales data into actionable insights that inform our go=to-market strategy, emphasizing focus areas, maximizing revenue, and preventing revenue leakage.

Essential Skills:

Holistic Business Understanding: Detailed comprehension of the sales business process and the ability to translate business needs into technical specifications.
Communication Prowess: Excellent interpersonal and communication skills, with the ability to articulate complex topics and present them thoughtfully to senior leaders.
Tech Savvy: Comfort with navigating the complexity of data across legacy and third-party platforms, ensuring forward momentum while simplifying and standardizing.
Organizational Agility : Strong time-management and organizational skills to balance multiple competing priorities.
Data Expertise: Background with ETL logic, data modeling concepts, and 5+ years of experience in a technical data role.

Requirements

Bachelor’s degree in business, finance, or computer-related program
5+ years of experience in a technical data role, such as analyst, engineer, architect, or scientist 5
5+ years of experience with multiple versions of SQL
5+ years of experience building and maintaining Tableau dashboards

Preferred Skills

Proficiency with Salesforce Sales Cloud (Marketing & Services Clouds a plus)
Proficiency with cloud databases such as Google BigQuery or Snowflake
Experience with machine learning concepts such as predictive modeling, categorization, and clustering
Background with programming in a language such as R or Python
Experience working in or supporting Sales or Revenue Operations a plus

What to expect from Pearson

Did you know Pearson is one of the 10 most innovative education companies of 2022?

At Pearson, we add life to a lifetime of learning so everyone can realize the life they imagine. We do this by creating vibrant and enriching learning experiences designed for real-life impact. We are on a journey to be 100 percent digital to meet the changing needs of the global population by developing a new strategy with ambitious targets. To deliver on our strategic vision, we have five business divisions that are the foundation for the long-term growth of the company: Assessment & Qualifications, Virtual Learning, English Language Learning, Workforce Skills and Higher Education. Alongside these, we have our corporate divisions: Digital & Technology, Finance, Global Corporate Marketing & Communications, Human Resources, Legal, Strategy and Direct to Consumer. Learn more at We are Pearson.

We value the power of an inclusive culture and also a strong sense of belonging. We promote a culture where differences are embraced, opportunities are accessible, consideration and respect are the norm and all individuals are supported in reaching their full potential. Through our talent, we believe that diversity, equity and inclusion make us a more innovative and vibrant place to work. People are at the center, and we are committed to building a workplace where talent can learn, grow and thrive.

Pearson is an Affirmative Action and Equal Opportunity Employer and a member of E-Verify. We want a team that represents a variety of backgrounds, perspectives and skills. The more inclusive we are, the better our work will be. All employment decisions are based on qualifications, merit and business need. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, ethnicity, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, gender expression, age, national origin, protected veteran status, disability status or any other group protected by law. We strive for a workforce that reflects the diversity of our communities.

AtriCure, Inc. provides innovative technologies for the treatment of Afib and related conditions. Afib affects more than 33 million people worldwide. Electrophysiologists and cardiothoracic surgeons around the globe use AtriCure technologies for the treatment of Afib and reduction of Afib related complications. AtriCure’s Isolator® Synergy™ Ablation System is the first medical device to receive FDA approval for the treatment of persistent Afib. AtriCure’s AtriClip® Left Atrial Appendage Exclusion System products are the most widely sold LAA management devices worldwide. AtriCure’s Hybrid AF™ Therapy is a minimally invasive procedure that provides a lasting solution for long-standing persistent Afib patients. AtriCure’s cryoICE cryoSPHERE® probe is cleared for temporary ablation of peripheral nerves to block pain, providing pain relief in cardiac and thoracic procedures. For more information, visit AtriCure.com or follow us on Twitter @AtriCure.

We foster a culture of inclusion by embracing diverse experiences and individuals where everyone’s authentic self is welcome. We offer supporting programs and resources that provide enriching and equitable opportunities for each person to contribute professionally and personally.

POSITION SUMMARY:
The Senior PLM Business Analyst (BA) will assist the PLM Business Solution Architect to consult and collaborate with business teams to capture and analyze current PLM business practices and systems, assist in architecting future state PLM solutions based on industry best practices enabled by computer-aided design (CAD), PLM and related technologies, and ensure technical alignment with AtriCure’s 3DExperience PLM platform. This role will partner with business stakeholders, Product Owners, SME’s, solution architects, data analysts, solution providers, and support personnel following the Agile framework and delivery. The PLM BA plays a critical role in capturing business, functional, system level requirements and serves as the liaison between the business and the IT development team to ensure the end solution adequately meets all requirements.

ESSENTIAL FUNCTIONS OF THE POSITION:

Assist the team in the design of future state PLM solutions (process models enabled by CAD, PLM and related technologies) based on industry best practices and aligned with Dassault ENOVIA 3DExperience PLM platform for the following areas: document management, quality management, advanced product configuration management, change control, managed CAD in PLM, systems engineering and requirements management, risk management (FMEAs), materials management and compliance, and integrations with CRM, ERP, MES, Reporting & Analytics platforms
Collaborate with business’ legacy system owners and IT to define the scope and requirements for migrating legacy PLM and CAD data to the configured 3DExperience application
Assist the team in archiving and retiring legacy systems and associated data
Perform basic mockups, configurations on the Dassault ENOVIA 3DExperience PLM platform to facilitate future state solutioning workshops and align with out-of-the-box capabilities to minimize configuration and customization effort
Work closely with the business Product Owner and PLM Solution Architect to author and refine Agile features and associated user stories with clear and accurate acceptance criteria definition.
Quality Assurance and Incident Resolution: Assist the team through authoring and executing test scripts for verification, validation and capture results. Communicate and help rectify gaps, bugs, missed requirements for the developed solution that are exposed during testing to ensure delivered solution meets all requirements
Assist Project Lead / Scrum Master to keep projects on schedule and hold team accountable to the AtriCure delivery process
Assist with the development of training materials, socializing, and training business users on the future state PLM solution and mitigating solution gaps
Assist in the continuous improvement of AtriCure’s project delivery methodology including implementing improved revision and change control practices for living artifacts (e.g., requirements, source code, technical specifications, test plans & scripts, release packages, etc.)
ADDITIONAL ESSENTIAL FUNCTIONS OF THE POSITION:

Experience with Continuous Delivery frameworks, Microsoft Azure and DevOps specifically
Familiarity with cloud-based Enterprise Application platforms used to support cross-functional business areas
Proven experience in conducting current state analysis and modeling future state solutions and related tools
Thorough understanding and proven experience with core, out-of-the-box 3DExperience functionality for change control, document management, product configuration management, and managed CAD.
BASIC QUALIFICATIONS:

Bachelor’s degree or higher in science, computing technology, or engineering discipline is required.
5+ years of experience working as a BA or comparable role with ENOVIA 3DExperience PLM platform (preferably 2021x or higher) with proven ability to demonstrate 3DExperience capabilities and facilitate requirements gathering workshops
8+ years of experience working with project teams to successfully implement ENOVIA 3DExperience solutions (preferrable) and/or other enterprise PLM package solutions for discrete manufacturers
Ability to interpret, understand and analyze complex legacy business processes, systems, and associated data, model and map to the future state solution
Proven experience in authoring requirements specifications for PLM solutions (features & user stories)
Working experience in an onsite-offshore model and collaborating with developers to meet the project schedule
Proven experience in providing input to quality assurance strategies, authoring, and executing test scripts and playing a significant role in the incident resolution process
Ability to partner across all levels in the organization to initiate, develop and maintain effective working relationships
Understanding of the various application development lifecycles (e.g., Agile, RUP, and Waterfall)
Exceptional communication skills (written and verbal)
Ability to travel 10%
PREFERRED QUALIFICATIONS:

Excellent understanding of business complexity and project interdependencies
Minimum of two years experience working in the medical devices or health sciences industry supporting and/or providing business-process-enabling technologies
Two years experience using or supporting CAD data management systems – preferably Solidworks
3 years of combined experience working in Agile environment with multiple teams and dependencies in an enterprise organization
Trained or certified Agile Product Owner
Experience w/ using automated testing tools is desirable
OTHER REQUIREMENTS:

Ability to regularly walk, sit, or stand as required
Ability to occasionally bend and push/pull
Ability to occasionally lift up to 10 pounds
Ability to pass pre-employment drug screen and background check
Salary range of $105,500 to $136,500. The pay for the successful candidate will depend on various factors (e.g., qualifications, education, prior experience). You may also be entitled to receive bonus, benefits, and more.

Responsibilities & Qualifications:
RESPONSIBILITIES
Supports agencies by analyzing propositions and assessing decision-making factors, such as strategic alignment, cost/benefit, and risk.
Works closely with the Product Manager to define a product approach to meet the specified user need.
Defines skill requirements and maps internal, agency, and external (partners/specialist contractors) resources.
Works with the owning agency to ensure they have the budget to cover the proposed approach and resource requirements during delivery and analyzes what provision they have for on-going running costs.
Analyzes and maps the risks of a product approach and proposes mitigation solutions.
Defines how the predicted user and financial benefit can be realized, and how channel shift will be measured.
Makes a recommendation for action against the analysis done.
REQUIRED QUALIFICATIONS

3 years of relevant Business Analyst experience
Bachelor’s degree in an IT discipline preferred
Active DoD Secret Security Clearance required
Understanding of data mapping, data integrity, data relationships, and dashboard customization
Proven ability to apply industry standard modeling techniques with broad understanding of analysis and IT industry, e.g., emerging technologies, industry standards, support services, architectures, systems design, and systems integration and solid knowledge of analysis and accepted IT processes and methodologies
Experience in client interaction and understanding business application, business data flow, data sharing, data validation, and data mapping.
Working knowledge of supporting applications Atlassian suite (Jira, Confluence, Bamboo).
Must have experience working in an Agile development team.
Ability to work independently, prioritize effectively, multitask, and manage time appropriately.
Results oriented, independently driven, self-motivated with advanced analytical and problem-solving abilities.
Record of accomplishment of delivering results, setting strategy, and leading a large volume and high-profile customer; including influencing stakeholders and working in cross-functional projects.
Excellent organizational skills including prioritizing, scheduling, time management, and meeting deadlines.
Strong communicator, ability to concisely communicate complex information.
Ability to create original documentation, including Architectural and Process Flow Diagrams.
Previous experience with supporting Federal Government customers preferred.

We are seeking a Business Analyst to join our team supporting the FBI’s Criminal Justice Information Services Division.

The Associate Logistics Manager - Projects is responsible for leading continuous improvement projects, applying lean and Total Productive Maintenance (TPM) methodologies, and driving efficiencies by streamlining process flow and distribution center layout. In addition, this position will ensure metrics are being reported as well as lead root cause analysis to identify potential issues. Will also work to bring solutions to enable the site to achieve peak productivity as soon as possible after go-lives.

Examples of projects across the network include:

Supporting the smooth roll-out of the Warehouse Management System (WMS) for our new/existing distribution centers in North America.

Establishing, validating and implementing Labor Management System (LMS) processes and assisting the North American distribution centers to reach goals as defined by these engineered standards.

This high visibility role will require extended travel during the site openings and roll-outs. There is a formal PMO deployment team and a “Project High-Score” team nationally that will work collaboratively to drive success as a cohesive team.

Extended travel will be expected the first year


What You Will Do:

Deploy to NA sites as they go live on our new WMS and LMS systems; boots on the ground to support the sites

Collaborate with functional leaders on key performance metrics that are tracking the recovery efforts of each go live

Drive engagement with the local teams and the support functions; using metrics to drive decisions

Monitor site and shift performance metrics and provide necessary actions to improve productivity

Align expectations for go lives; establish realistic timelines for each site to be achieve daily KPIs

Provide root cause analysis of daily service escalations and provide corrective action feedback to leadership teams

Assist the overall site operations leader in developing and implementing site process improvements, operational changes, and collaborate on project initiatives.

Serve as a liaison and mentor to shift supervisors and hourly leads to insure daily operational activities and goals are met.

Drive logistics plans through clear communication and close co-operation with Customer Service, Materials Planning, Manufacturing and major suppliers/vendors.

Partner with Quality, Planning, Manufacturing, Carriers & Customers to proactively avoid & resolve quality and service issues relating to logistics.

Manage projects to improve performance and meet customer needs, generating and implementing innovations for improved performance and a logistical competitive advantage.

Monitor fixed assets and coordinate implementation of approved CARs, and support budgeting for site logistics with focus on continuously improving year over year performance against metrics.

Manage inventory control, warehousing, transportation, logistics planning, order processing & customer service driving performance to metrics through the communication standard logistics metrics to direct reports and effectively resolving quality, service & cost issues.

Additional duties as assigned.


Minimum Qualifications:

Bachelor’s degree

6+ years of supply chain, logistics or related experience

Proven experience with project management and/or business analysis

Strong problem-solving, analytic, conceptual, and critical thinking skills

Excellent communications skills both verbal and written, including executive level presentations

No immigration sponsorship available for this role

Ability to travel up to 90% of the time


Preferred Qualifications:

Bachelor’s degree in Logistics / Supply Chain, Operations, Engineering or Mathematics

SAP operations and reporting capability

Self-starter with detail orientation; persistence and ability to work independently to drive execution.

Solid understanding of supply chain drivers and key sensitivities, with business performance reporting experience

Ability to synthesize/analyze complex and diverse information and to develop and recommend strategies and communicate them clearly

Ability to perform ad-hoc analysis, glean and form business insights under aggressive timelines

Demonstrated ability to manage complexity/ambiguity and multiple initiatives

Job Title: Health and Human Resources Specialist, Senior - DHHR/SEC - Kanawha Co.
Job Description:
Nature of Work

As a PATH Child Welfare Business Systems Analyst, this position serves as a statewide expert of defined focus areas within the CW application and requires expertise in both the program content and the technical skills needed to support the software serving the program. This position collaborates with stakeholders to promote, protect, manage, and provide appropriate health and human services for our residents to improve their health, well-being, and quality of life. This position provides expert business analysis in the development, enhancement, and maintenance of all DHHR computer systems to provide customers and staff systems that is efficient, well maintained, and compliant with Federal and State Requirements. The position fills the gap between state technical staff, IT contractors (mainly OPTUM) and state policy staff to assure that what is programmed in the application (FACTS, OSCAR, RAPIDS, or PATH) is implemented appropriately and correctly to follow the system rules while also following the policies/administrative rules that govern the programs.


IMPORTANT: Your eligible score will be based on information provided in your application; therefore, make sure your application is detailed and complete. You MUST complete ALL parts of the application, including the Work Experience section.

ATTENTION: Applicant must verify post high school education by submitting an official transcript or diploma, training or licensure earned pertaining to this position by the closing date of the posting, if not previously verified. If you are claiming Veterans preference, please submit "MEMBER 4" form and/or your VA Letter.

Please attach documents to the online application before submitting it. Or, you may email it to: applicantservices@wv.gov or by mail to: WV Division of Personnel, 1900 Kanawha Blvd. E., Building 3, Suite 500, Charleston, WV 25305.

This announcement is for one or more specific vacancies and only applies to the location(s) indicated. Your application will remain active for this job for 180 days or until the job is filled. Application for this job does not automatically qualify you for other positions. Be sure to submit your application for each position of interest. To receive an email notice anytime jobs in this or other categories are posted, you may choose to complete a Job Interest Card from the slide-out menu located at the top left of our Job Opportunities page.



Minimum Qualifications

Training: Bachelor's Degree from a regionally accredited four-year college or university.

Substitution: Additional experience as described below may be substituted for the required training on a year-for-year basis.

Experience: Four years full-time, equivalent part-time paid or volunteer experience in a technical or program area that is related to the area of employment.
Substitution: Post-graduate education in a field related to the technical or program area may be substituted for the required experience on the basis of fifteen semester hours for one year of experience.

***DETAILS OF RELATED EXPERIENCE MUST BE SHOWN IN THE WORK EXPERIENCE SECTION OF YOUR ONLINE APPLICATION***
